Siegfriedson

How Much Does America Pay for Supporting the Israelis?
 
 by Tom Stauffer
 
 Alfred Lilienthal posed the question of what the cost of supporting Israel was to the US 40 years ago, when the price tag for Americans was low.
 
 Today the answer is knowable and daunting - the figure comes to at least $1.6 trillion through the end of 2002.
 
 That is some three times the much-publicized cost of the Vietnam War (all figures are expressed in current dollars, corrected for inflation). The overall cost to the US of all aspects of conflicts in the Middle East is even higher _ more than $2.6 trillion.
 
 But the multi-dimensioned costs of supporting and protecting Israel make up nearly two-thirds of the total.
 
 Continued:
 
 http://www.nationalvanguard.org/story.php?id=2236
 
 
 The High Price of American Alliance With Israel
 
 By Lisa Guliani
 
 The U.S. government doles out more money per year to help Israeli citizens than it does to help Americans. Think about how bizarre that is for a moment. Yet, nobody DARES to challenge this openly. Okay, so I'll challenge it.
 
 And, in FY2003, our President requested "Foreign Assistance" funds for Israel as follows:
 
 *For Counter Terrorism for FY 2002: $28 Million
 *For Foreign Military Financing: $2.1 Billion
 *For Economic Support: $600 Million
 *For Refugee Settlement Funds: $60 Million
 
 Continued:
 
 http://www.federalobserver.com/archive.php?aid=5901

post_info.post_title: Israel Hits US Taxpayers in the Wallet

Siegfriedson

The Strategic Function of US Aid to Israel
 
 By Stephen Zunes
 
 Dr. Zunes is an assistant professor in the Department of Politics at the University of San Francisco
 
 Since 1992, the U.S. has offered Israel an additional $2 billion annually in loan guarantees. Congressional researchers have disclosed that between 1974 and 1989, $16.4 billion in U.S. military loans were converted to grants and that this was the understanding from the beginning.
 
 Indeed, all past U.S. loans to Israel have eventually been forgiven by Congress, which has undoubtedly helped Israel's often-touted claim that they have never defaulted on a U.S. government loan. U.S. policy since 1984 has been that economic assistance to Israel must equal or exceed Israel's annual debt repayment to the United States. Unlike other countries, which receive aid in quarterly installments, aid to Israel since 1982 has been given in a lump sum at the beginning of the fiscal year, leaving the U.S. government to borrow from future revenues. Israel even lends some of this money back through U.S. treasury bills and collects the additional interest.
 
 Continued:
 
 http://www.washington-report.org/us_aid_to_israel/index.htm
 
 
 The Real Cost of US Support for Israel: $3 Trillion
 
 http://www.thetruthseeker.co.uk/article.asp?ID=831

Darn this character minimum..
 
 Ahem, that is all.

Let's Not Forget: March, 2003 - Israel Annoys Bush Adminstration by Flapping Their Lips About Huge "Aid" Package
 
 Israel has irritated the US by revealing private assurances from Condoleezza Rice to Benjamin Netanyahu that the White House has approved $10,000,000,000 in aid before it was formally announced in Washington.
 
 In a phone conversation on Wednesday, Ms Rice, the US national security adviser, told Mr Netanyahu, Israel's finance minister, that the White House was willing to provide $9 billion in loan guarantees to prop up Israel's sinking economy and another $1 billion in military aid.
 
 Mr Netanyahu announced the deal to the Israeli press.

As for the Jews, I resent their grip on America's politicians and the media. They have convinced our Congressmen to send Israel billions and billions of dollars annually. As if that isn't bad enough, the Arabs know that America and Israel are in bed together, and they have attacked America repeatedly based on this fact (i.e., Sept. 11).
